item.title: Report E-2023120135
item.description:
Report E-2023120135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, at 1400 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in St. Louis, Missouri regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of MASCID 0898 (UN3265, Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Organic, N.O.S., 8 III) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Contractors were able to neutralized the release and cleaned it with absorbents and the proper PPE. The impacted drum was then transferred into (1) poly overpack without complication, and the waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120112
item.description:
Report E-2023120112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The XSW terminal loaded a pallet on top of another pallet of metal pails containing "PC-500LC" UN1263, Paint Related Material, 3, PGII, which crushed one pail that released the content to the trailer interior and onto 7 more pails of the product. Upon review of the SDS, it was determined with the terminal that staff could safely clean the spill, carefully keeping the material away from ignition sources, avoiding eating/drinking/smoking near the spill, and using skin/eye PPE as well as absorbents to clean the spilled material. The 8 total damaged pails, spilled material, and spent absorbents will be held in a 33gal metal drum onsite as waste for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120109
item.description:
Report E-2023120109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: a five-gallon spill of regulated UN1263 "Black Metallic Paint" that was released at Terminal XSJ. (1) five-gallon plastic pail was punctured by a forklift during offloading operations impacting the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 20-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the punctured metal pail, the remaining product, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023111327
item.description:
Report X-2023111327

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-E. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED RESPONSE CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 16 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE SIDE WALL AND BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS SEEN WET AS PACKAGE HANDLER ATTEMPTED TO PUT ON THE BELT. IMMEDIATELY SECURED AND BELT NEITRALIZED WITH PH POWDER DescribePack: 1 BOTTLE IS CRACKED/PUNCTURED. APPEARS TO BE MISHANDLED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PUT IN A HAZ BUCKET WITH HAZ BAG AND FOLD ABSORB TO STOP LEAK

item.title: Report X-2023110886
item.description:
Report X-2023110886

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON OUR UNLOADING DOCK LEAKING IN A TOTE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE HAZMAT INSIDE THE CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE 20L PLASTIC BAG OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID HAD THE LID COME LOOSE CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT INTO THE PACKAGE SOAKING THROUGH IT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023110778
item.description:
Report X-2023110778

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING POWDER ON OUR LOADING DOCK. THE ADMIN WAS CALLED OUT TO PICK IT UP AND THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED TOTE THEN BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE CONTAINS A 20LB FIRE EXTINGUISHER WHICH WAS LAYING DOWN INSIDE THE OVERSIZED BOX WITH A LOT OF PAPER FOR PACKING HAD THE HANDLE BECOME BENT CAUSING THE SEAL TO BREAK AND ALLOWING THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER TO GO OFF INSIDE THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED FIRE EXTINGUISHER HAS BEEN REPACKED FOR PROCESSING.
